title: New Virgin Atlantic Logo
content:
"Virgin Atlantic" on the plane.  
 [http://www.airliners.net/open.file/1125202/L/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/www.airliners.net/open.file/1125202/L/ "http://www.airliners.net/open.file/1125202/L/")

Any takers?

Best,  
Will
author: winglets747

comments.content:
It's appropriately mainstream I guess. :-/  
But the truncation of the "g" is a classic case of bloated corporation idiocy.

hhp

Looks a lot like a stretched Neo Tech (with customized r)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-tech/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-tech/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-tech/")

I don't think the "g" is truncated; the decender just goes into the line of windows and is hard to see.

I still think its boring. Now, _this_ is great looking livery:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SWA2005083030149_pv_5647.jpg)

Yowza! (More [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/gallery.swamedia.com/photos/kw=SWAaircraftSpecialty).)

It is a little bit like my Align Sans too.

ChrisL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859im_/http:/typophile.com/files/virginatlantic_3795.png)

Probably custom, but some in the style:

[HGB Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/hgb-grotesk/)  
 [Magistral](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=magistral)  
 [Simian Orangutan](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109082859/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=24&subpage=viewfonts)
